pjv.evolution.genetic

Class AbstractIndividual

  • java.lang.Object
    • pjv.evolution.genetic.AbstractIndividual
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractIndividual>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Individual

    public abstract class AbstractIndividual
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<AbstractIndividual>
    Abstract class for individuals in evolutionary algorithm. It defines the genotype, among with related operations such as the mutation and the crossover, as well as computing fitness.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractIndividual()

      Crosses the current individual over with other individual given as a parameter, yielding a pair of offsprings.

      Creates a deep copy of the current individual, i.e.

      Gets the fitness value of the individual.

      Determines whether a graph node of given index (starting from 0) is part of the vertex cover encoded by the individual.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractIndividual

        public AbstractIndividual()

    • Method Detail

      • getFitness

        public abstract double getFitness()
        Gets the fitness value of the individual. Make sure computeFitness is always invoked prior to getting the fitness value.
        Returns:
        The fitness value of the current individual

      • computeFitness

        public abstract void computeFitness()
        Evaluates the value of the fitness function for the individual. After the fitness is computed, the getFitness may be called repeatedly, saving computation time.

      • isNodeSelected

        public abstract boolean isNodeSelected(int j)
        Determines whether a graph node of given index (starting from 0) is part of the vertex cover encoded by the individual.
        Parameters:
        j - Index of the node in the graph.
        Returns:
        true if the j-th node is part of the vertex cover, false if not

      • deepCopy

        public abstract AbstractIndividual deepCopy()
        Creates a deep copy of the current individual, i.e. a new individual with the same internal data. This is necessary for genetic operations like mutation, crossover, etc.
        Returns:
        A new individual identical to the current

      • crossover

        public abstract Pair crossover(AbstractIndividual other)
        Crosses the current individual over with other individual given as a parameter, yielding a pair of offsprings.
        Parameters:
        other - The other individual to be crossed over with
        Returns:
        A couple of offspring individuals

      • mutate

        public abstract void mutate(double mutationProbability)
        Does random changes in the individual's genotype, taking mutation probability into account.
        Parameters:
        mutationProbability - Probability of a bit being inverted, i.e. a node being added to/removed from the vertex cover.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(AbstractIndividual another)
        Compares the individuals based on their fitness. Must be compatible with Java compare usage: +1 if this is greater than the other -1 if this is smaller than the other, 0 if they are equal
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<AbstractIndividual>
        Parameters:
        another - the second individual
